TUBERCULOSIS.Definition: a serious disease, especially affecting the lungs

DISTRIBUTE.Definition: market and sell (films) to cinemas and customers

DISTRIBUTOR.Definition: a company that markets and sells films

REEL.Definition: a wheel shaped object which old films used to be held on

EQUIVALENT.Definition: being of the same value as

DISTRIBUTION.Definition: the selling and marketing (of a film)

PERMISSION.Definition: if you have permission to do something, you are allowed to do it

OWN.Definition: if you own something, it belongs to you

RIGHTS.Definition: the legal ability to do or have something

MERCHANDISING.Definition: the selling of products connected with a film, song etc.

COMIC BOOKS.Definition: books with illustrated figures, usually making you laugh

ADVERTS.Definition: films, posters or pictures created by companies in order to make you want to buy something

SOLD ON.Definition: if you are sold on something, you believe it and want to do it

BOX OFFICE.Definition: if a film makes a certain amount of money at the box office, it is how much money people pay (in total) to see the film

OVERTAKEN.Definition: if something is overtaken, something else has become more successful or more important than it

FEATURE-LENGTH.Definition: a feature-length film is a full-length film

BANKRUPTCY.Definition: (of a business) the state of running out of money

INTO THE FLOW OF THINGS.Definition: if you are in the flow of things, you are in a good state

AMUSEMENT PARK.Definition: a type of park with rides

THEME PARK.Definition: a type of park with rides, often with a unified theme

ATTRACTIONS.Definition: rides and games at an adventure park

RIDES.Definition: the large machines that people go on for fun (at a park)

THEME PARKS.Definition: types of park with rides, often with a unified theme

CHARACTER.Definition: qualities of a person (who a person really is)

PUBLIC-FACING.Definition: what people in the public see

AWARE.Definition: conscious, knowing that something exists or is true

MANIPULATOR.Definition: someone who changes something, normally in a negative way

FATHER.Definition: if you are the father of something, you are the important person for it

BREAD AND BUTTER.Definition: if something is your bread and butter, it isn't necessarily exciting but makes money for you

CRUISE LINES.Definition: very large ships people used for holidays

SUBSCRIPTION.Definition: paying money to receive access to a regular service

SPENDING SPREE.Definition: a period where you spend lots of money

FRANCHISE.Definition: the right to sell a product or brand

TENTACLES.Definition: the long, thin legs of a sea creature e.g. octopus

APPEAL.Definition: a quality that makes people like it
